div.p: My big friend base was outside the Police because I played football locally and other sports and joined clubs and all the rest of it
and I think that gave me a better balance, sort of balanced view, of what was going on because when you’re in a Police environment
you become very insular and everyone’s a wrong ‘un and everyone’s up to no good and goodness knows what, I used to go out for
the Christmas parties and all the rest of it but very rarely socialised with officers and now having left I keep in touch with 2 or 3 but that is it,
you know, it was a job but my friend base for a reason was outside the job to keep my feet on the ground.
I keep myself fit and healthy, I have got an old injury from the Army which impacted on me massively but I’ve overcome it and
I remember when I joined the Police it took me 4 months to get through the medical because of the injury and stuff; it didn’t affect me
in my work life then I think now as I’ve got a little bit older and a little bit chubbier and what have you my knees ache and my hips ache
and stuff like that but I’d say that I’m in good health. Shift work is not good for you you don’t sleep properly and I never have, I still don’t sleep
very well now, 3 or 4 hours a night and that’s it and I always have done I think I always will do and that’s because of my Police service...
